results.title: Blues Clues: Blue's big treasure hunt
results.creator_credit: Nick Jr, Viacom International, Wendy Harris, Todd Kessler, Angela Santomero and Traci Johnson
results.brief_description: Popular young children’s television program. Encourages children to interact with Steve and follow Steve and his dog Blue on two treasure hunts. Promotes thinking skills such as problem solving and visual perception.

results.title: Blueprint for the future: Melbourne 1985
results.brief_description: Describes the Master Plan intended to cope with Melbourne’s traffic situation in 1985. Intense survey work has been carried out, the information analysed in computers and the appropriate plans made, mainly in the form of overpasses and freeways. Stresses the need for a revitalised public transport system as well as roads. Underground railways and streamlined trains and buses are needed. Includes plans for St Kilda Junction, Westgate Bridge and the Melbourne Loop system. Narrated by Leonard Teale.

results.title: Blueprint for survival
results.creator_credit: Mantis Wildlife Films, Densey Clyne and Jim Frazier
results.brief_description: Shows the development of moth, beetle, lacewing and fly larvae, through periodic shedding of the rigid outer coating. Stages in nymphal development of the grasshopper, praying mantis, phasmid and sucking bug, final moult of a cicada and tree cricket and emergence of a butterfly are shown. Suitable for secondary years 7-12.

results.title: Bluegrass country
results.brief_description: A film of the annual Bluegrass Music Festival at Berryville, Virginia. Conveys the history of this indigenous American folk-music through the high-energy performances of the professional musicans and impromtu jam sessions of their fans. The performers discuss their music. No other credits available.

results.title: Bluebeard's castle
results.brief_description: Starring Kolos Kovats as Bluebeard and Sylvia Sass as Judith, with Sir Georg Solti conducting the London Philharmonic Orchestra, “Bluebeard’s Castle” is a parable on trust and communication. Bluebeard brings his new wife into the hall of his castle. Despite the gloominess and the rumours she has heard about the disappearance of his previous wives, Judith has chosen to join her husband. She discovers seven large doors and asks why they are bolted. Bluebeard replies that no-one is to see what is behind them. Judith manages to get into the first door and sees that it is a torture chamber. Behind the second door is an armoury, the third, a treasury and the fourth, a secret garden. Behind the sixth door, Judith sees still water, she asks what it is and Bluebeard tells her that it is tears. The seventh door reveals Bluebeard’s former wives and in silence, they step forward. Bluebeard introduces them to Judith. The first he found in the morning, the second he found at noon and the third, he found in the evening. Judith is the wife he found at midnight. He proceeds to weigh her down with a cloak and jewels and now she must join all the other wives. As she does so, Bluebeard returns to the hall alone and in darkness. Opera in one act by Bela Balazs and music by Bela Bartok.

results.title: Blue water challenge
results.creator_credit: Academy Film Productions and Ronald Mason
results.brief_description: A stimulating and accurate portrayal of the Golden Fleece Great Circle Yacht Race, which makes a clockwise circumnavigation of Tasmania. Starting off Portsea, Victoria, in January 1980, a fleet of Australia’s leading ocean racing yachts sailon a course of over 800 miles of challenging stretches of water. It has now become the longest race which starts and finishes in Australia. No other credits available.

results.title: Blue watch
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Living with Danger”.
One of the BBC series “Living with Danger” this film deals with the work of the Fire Service in the United Kingdom. The routine training courses and varied duties for full-time and part-time recruits are shown, and the highly disciplined teams of modern fire-fighters are also revealed as family and home-loving men, with spare time activities and individual hobbies. Culminates in a spectacular fire-fighting operation against a quickly spreading factory fire.
